page.title: 02ROADS IN BEWCASTLE
page.content: The only classified road to enter the area is the B6318, which goes from Gilsland to Langholm.This road passes through the south-west corner of our rectangle.From that road two other lanes lead off, one to Newcastleton, over the Scottish border, and the other,a cul-de-sac, ends at the Flatt, a large farm.Between these roads are several old tracks, joining farms and once providing routeways for horses and pedestrians.Where these tracks approach rivers they often need fords to cross, with footbridges or stepping stones for walkers. The roads have good surfaces for they have little traffic , livestock on the road being the main hazard except for Winter weather which occasionally causes problems.
